intro: Amblyoglossum longipes, commonly known as the long-beaked ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, purple to pinkish-red flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Amblyoglossum longipes is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
